sentences.text: General elections were held in the Dominican Republic on 19 May 2024 to elect a president, vice-president, 32 senators, 190 deputies and 20 Central American Parliament|PARLACEN deputies.

references.text: <ref>{{Cite web |title=2024 presidential election set for 19 May; municipal election will be on 18 February |url=https://dr1.com/news/2022/11/29/2024-presidential-election-set-for-19-may-municipal-election-will-be-on-18-february/ |access-date=2024-02-29 |website=DR1.com |language=en-US}}</ref>

<ref>{{cite news|title=R.Dominicana celebrará elecciones presidenciales el 19 de mayo de 2024|url=https://lapropuestadigital.com/r-dominicana-celebrara-elecciones-presidenciales-el-19-de-may/|date=December 15, 2022|accessdate=December 15, 2022|publisher=La Propuesta Digital|language=es-ES}}</ref>

<ref>{{cite news|title=Presidente de la JCE asegura que elecciones de 2024 se organizan y pagan en 2023|url=https://miradorcentral.com.do/presidente-de-la-jce-asegura-que-elecciones-de-2024-se-organizan-y-pagan-en-2023/|date=November 29, 2022|accessdate=November 29, 2022|publisher=Mirador pCentral|language=es-ES}}</ref>

<ref>{{cite news|title=En 2023 arranca en República Dominicana el proceso de cara a las elecciones de 2024|url=https://www.diariolibre.com/amp/actualidad/politica/2022/12/31/elecciones-2024-en-2023-arranca-el-montaje/2184487|date=December 31, 2022|accessdate=December 31, 2022|publisher=Listín Diario |language=es-ES}}</ref>

sentences.text: The 32 members of the Senate of the Dominican Republic|Senate are elected from the 31 provinces and the Distrito Nacional using first-past-the-post voting.

The 190 members of the Chamber of Deputies of the Dominican Republic|Chamber of Deputies are elected in three groups; 178 are elected by proportional representation from 32 multi-member constituencies based on the 31 provinces of the Dominican Republic|provinces and the Distrito Nacional, with the number of seats based on the population of each province. A further seven members are elected by proportional representation by Dominican expatriates in three overseas constituencies, and five seats are allocated at the national level to parties that received at least 1% of the vote nationally, giving preference to those that did not win any of the 178 constituency seats.

references.text: <ref name=IPU>[http://www.ipu.org/parline-e/reports/2093_B.htm Cámara de Diputados (Chamber of Deputies)] IPU</ref>

sentences.text: Around eight million people were eligible to vote in this election. Voting began at 07:00 on 19 May and closed at 17:00. The process was described as smooth, apart from small irregularities reported by opposition parties.<ref name="apvictory"/>

references.text: <ref>{{cite web|title=The day has arrived! Everything you need to know about the presidential and congressional elections being held in the Dominican Republic.|url=https://dominicantoday.com/dr/local/2024/05/19/the-day-has-arrived-everything-you-need-to-know-about-the-presidential-and-congressional-elections-being-held-in-the-dominican-republic/|date=May 19, 2024|accessdate=May 19, 2024|publisher=Dominican Today|language=en}}</ref>

<ref>{{cite news|title=Dominican Republic voters head to the polls with eyes on Haiti crisis |url=https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2024/5/19/dominican-republic-voters-head-to-the-polls-with-eyes-on-haiti-crisis |date=May 19, 2024|accessdate=May 19, 2024 |publisher=Al Jazeera |language=en}}</ref>

references.text: <ref>{{cite web | url=https://www.americasquarterly.org/article/meet-the-candidates-dominican-republic/ | title=Meet the Candidates: Dominican Republic }}</ref>

sentences.text: Among notable issues during the campaign was the effects of the Haitian crisis (2018–present)|political unrest in Haiti and increased migration from the latter country. During a debate, President Abinader pledged to continue the deportation of illegal immigrants and finish construction of a wall along the Dominican Republic–Haiti border|border with Haiti. Both Leonel Fernandez and Abel Martínez also supported a harsh stance on Haitian emigration|migration.

references.text: <ref name="Haiti">{{cite news|title=Haiti's crisis rises to the forefront of elections in neighboring Dominican Republic |url=https://apnews.com/article/dominican-republic-election-migration-haiti-90195a0af8a9becd201cf8a2c964f2e3|date=May 17, 2024|accessdate=May 17, 2024|publisher=Associated Press|language=en}}</ref>

sentences.text: Both Leonel Fernandez and Abel Martínez conceded to Abinader shortly after the release of the result. In his victory speech, Abinader said that the "changes that we’ve made are going to be irreversible”, adding that the "best is yet to come".

references.text: <ref name="apvictory">{{cite news|title=Dominican Republic President Luis Abinader heads to reelection as competitors concede early |url=https://apnews.com/article/dominican-republic-election-presidential-abinader-haiti-59d10ff3d422842c5f3988b34a39588a|date=May 20, 2024|accessdate=May 20, 2024|publisher=Associated Press|language=en}}</ref>

sentences.text: Re-elected President Abinader, after obtaining a supermajority in both houses, announced a constitutional reform.
